text: Gérard Latortue (19 June 1934 - 27 February 2023) was a Haitian politician and diplomat who served as the prime minister of Haiti from 12 March 2004 to 9 June 2006. He was an official in the United Nations for many years, and briefly served as foreign minister of Haiti during the short-lived 1988 administration of Leslie Manigat."Togo : Francophonie observers urge electoral commission to release results" , African Press Agency, October 16, 2007."Paysage après la bataille (électorale)", Jeuneafrique.com, October 22, 2007 . Latortue has three children. His daughter, Alexia, currently serves in the United States Department of the Treasury. "Togo : Francophonie observers urge electoral commission to release results" , African Press Agency, October 16, 2007."Paysage après la bataille (électorale)", Jeuneafrique.com, October 22, 2007 . Latortue died on 27 February 2023 in Boca Raton, Florida at the age of 88.Gérard Latortue, former interim Haitian premier, dies at 88 ==References== Category:Prime ministers of Haiti Category:1934 births Category:2023 deaths
title: Gérard Latortue
